00273 PcimapResultWidget*
00274 PcimapResultWidget::Instance( std::vector<PciDevice> lspci_list,
00275                               WContainerWidget* parent,
00276                               string board_name, // passed if showing a mainboard configuration
00277                               string ukernel_id) // passed if a specific OS support queried..
00278 {
00279   // create an instance of PcimapResultWidget, with default parameters if they are not passed as argument.
00280   instance_ = new PcimapResultWidget(lspci_list, parent, board_name, ukernel_id);
00281 
00282   return instance_;
00283 }
00284 
00285 PcimapResultWidget* PcimapResultWidget::Instance()
00286 {
00287   if ( !instance_ ){
00288     // there is no instance of PcimapResultWidget, so return NULL..
00289     return NULL;
00290   }
00291 
00292   return instance_;
00293 }

00329 /*
00330   Query the list of OSes that support the device with provided codes.
00331 */
00333 std::multimap<string, string>
00334 queryPcimapOsList(string vendor_code, string device_code, string subvendor_code, string subdevice_code,
00335                   string class_code, string subclass_code, string progif_code);

00339 
00340 
00341 std::vector<WStandardItem*>
00342 PcimapResultWidget::pciDeviceToRowItem( const PciDevice* current_item )
00343 {
00344   std::vector<string> full_class, full_device;  // Hold class and device names to be shown.
00345   
00346   std::vector<WStandardItem *> result;          // Hold the line to be returned.
00347   WStandardItem *item;
00348 
00349   full_class =  queryClassName(current_item->getClass(),    // Returns Class,Subclass,Progif names..
00350                                current_item->getSubclass(),
00351                                current_item->getProgif());
00352 
00353   full_device = queryDeviceName(current_item->getVendor(),  // Returns Vendor,Device,Subsys names..
00354                                 current_item->getDevice(),
00355                                 current_item->getSubvendor(),
00356                                 current_item->getSubdevice());
00357 
00358   // column 0:
00359   if( !full_class.empty() ){
00360     item = new WStandardItem( full_class.at(1) );       // Put just the Subclass name..
00361   }
00362   else
00363     item = new WStandardItem("Unknown Class");          // class-subclass pair doesnot exist in db!
00364 
00365   result.push_back(item);
00366 
00367   if( !full_device.empty() ){
00368     // column 1: 
00369     item = new WStandardItem( full_device.at(0) );      // Put the Vendor name..
00370     result.push_back(item);
00371 
00372     if( full_device.at(1) != "" )
00373       // column 2: 
00374       item = new WStandardItem( full_device.at(1) );    // Put the Device name..
00375     else
00376       item = new WStandardItem( "Unknown Device" );
00377     result.push_back(item);   
00378 
00379   }
00380   else{                         // Vendor-Device pair does not exist in database!
00381     string vendor_name;
00382     if( (vendor_name = queryPciVendorName(current_item->getVendor())) == "" ) // Query only for Vendor name.
00383       item = new WStandardItem( "Unknown Vendor" );
00384     else
00385       item = new WStandardItem( vendor_name );
00386     result.push_back(item);
00387     item = new WStandardItem( "Unknown Device" );
00388     result.push_back(item);
00389   }
00390 
00391   if( uKernelId_ != "" ){       // if unique OS ID is provided then put an extra Support column.
00392     item = new WStandardItem();
00393 
00394     // Query the list of OSes that support the current device!
00395     std::multimap<string,string> uKernel_mod_list; // (unique Kernel id, module name id)
00396     uKernel_mod_list = queryPcimapOsList(current_item->getVendor(), current_item->getDevice(),
00397                                          current_item->getSubvendor(),current_item->getSubdevice(),
00398                                          current_item->getClass(),current_item->getSubclass(),current_item->getProgif());
00399 
00400     // And search if the provided OS exists in the list of OSes that support the device..
00401     std::multimap<string,string>::iterator ukernel_mod_iter;
00402     ukernel_mod_iter = uKernel_mod_list.find( uKernelId_ );
00403     if( ukernel_mod_iter == uKernel_mod_list.end() ){   // NO module found for the Device with provided OS!!
00404       item->setIcon( supportIcons[0] );
00405     }
00406     else{                                               // Modules found for the device..
00407       item->setIcon( supportIcons[1] );
00408     }
00409     result.push_back(item);   
00410   }
00411   
00412   return result;
00413 }

00422 string queryModuleName( string mod_name_id );
00423 
00424 
00425 void PcimapResultWidget::lspciTableRowSelected(WModelIndex index, WMouseEvent event)
00426 {
00427   PciDevice* selected_item;
00428   selected_item = ( &lspci_list_.at(index.row()) );     // Put a pointer to the selected item on device list.
00429   fillDeviceDetails( *selected_item );                  // Display codes of selected device.
00430 
00431   std::multimap<string,string> uKernel_mod_list;        // (unique Kernel id, module name id)
00432 
00433   // Query the list of OSes that support the current device!
00434   uKernel_mod_list = queryPcimapOsList( selected_item->getVendor(), selected_item->getDevice(),
00435                                         selected_item->getSubvendor(),selected_item->getSubdevice(),
00436                                         selected_item->getClass(), selected_item->getSubclass(), selected_item->getProgif() );
00437 
00438   
00439   std::vector<string> os;                               // Hold the full OS name,
00440   string module_name;                                   // And the name of the module in that OS.
00441   std::vector< std::vector<string> > os_list;           // Make a list of entries from the above two.
00442 
00443   
00444   // Iterate through the list of queried OSes!
00445   std::multimap<string,string>::iterator ukernel_iter;
00446   for ( ukernel_iter=uKernel_mod_list.begin(); ukernel_iter!=uKernel_mod_list.end(); ++ukernel_iter ){
00447     
00448     os = queryOs( ukernel_iter->first );                    // Retrieve full OS name from it's ID,
00449     module_name = queryModuleName( ukernel_iter->second );  // and the module that supports the device.
00450     // Append the module to the list, so we know which module of what OS supports the device!
00451     os.push_back(module_name);
00452 
00453     os_list.push_back(os);                                  // Put the OS in list to be displayed.
00454   }
00455 
00456   osSupportModel_->removeRows(0, osSupportModel_->rowCount());  // Clear the source model of table.
00457   if( !os_list.empty() ){
00458     std::vector< std::vector<string> >::iterator os_iter;
00459     for( os_iter=os_list.begin(); os_iter!=os_list.end(); ++os_iter )
00460       // Call osSupportRow() function with each OS entry to create a corresponding line
00461       // and add each line to model source to be displayed.
00462       osSupportModel_->appendRow( osToSupportRow( *os_iter ) );
00463   }
00464 
00465 }
00466 
00467 
00468 
00469 std::vector<WStandardItem*>
00470 PcimapResultWidget::osToSupportRow( const std::vector<string>& os )
00471 {
00472   std::vector<WStandardItem *> result;          // Hold the line to be returned.
00473   WStandardItem *item;
00474   if( !os.empty() ){
00475     // column 0:
00476     item = new WStandardItem( os.at(0) );       // Put distribution name.
00477     result.push_back(item);
00478 
00479     // column 1: 
00480     item = new WStandardItem( os.at(1) );       // Put release name.
00481     result.push_back(item);
00482   
00483     // column 2: 
00484     item = new WStandardItem( os.at(2) );       // Put kernel version.
00485     result.push_back(item);
00486 
00487     // column 3:
00488     item = new WStandardItem( os.at(3) );       // Put architecture.
00489     result.push_back(item);
00490 
00491     // column 4:
00492     item = new WStandardItem( os.at(4) );       // Put module name.
00493     result.push_back(item);
00494 
00495   }
00496 
00497   return result;
00498 }

00501 
00502 void PcimapResultWidget::fillDeviceDetails( const PciDevice& selected_device )
00503 {
00504   // Fill in the edit line with device codes.
00505   editVendor_->setText( selected_device.getVendor() );
00506   editDevice_->setText( selected_device.getDevice() );
00507   editSubvendor_->setText( selected_device.getSubvendor() );
00508   editSubdevice_->setText( selected_device.getSubdevice() );
00509   editClass_->setText( selected_device.getClass() );
00510   editSubclass_->setText( selected_device.getSubclass() );
00511   editProgif_->setText( selected_device.getProgif() );
00512 }

00516 
00517 void PcimapResultWidget::bSaveBoard_Click()
00518 {
00519   dialogBoard_ = new WDialog("Save Mainboard");
00520 
00521   // Ask user for the mainboard name to be saved.
00522   new WText("Store Mainboard configuration on Database! <br />Model Name: ", dialogBoard_->contents() );
00523   editBoard_ = new WLineEdit( dialogBoard_->contents() );
00524   new WBreak( dialogBoard_->contents() );
00525   WPushButton* dialogBoardOk = new WPushButton("Ok", dialogBoard_->contents());
00526   WPushButton* dialogBoardCancel = new WPushButton("Cancel", dialogBoard_->contents());
00527 
00528   // Sets WDialog::DialogCode to Accepted when OK is clicked.
00529   (*dialogBoardOk).clicked().connect( SLOT(dialogBoard_, WDialog::accept) );
00530 
00531   // Sets WDialog::DialogCode to Rejected when Cancel is clicked.
00532   (*dialogBoardCancel).clicked().connect( SLOT(dialogBoard_, WDialog::reject) );
00533 
00534   dialogBoard_->show();
00535 
00536   // Trigger 'dialogBoard_Close' function on 'dialogBoard_' dialog window close.
00537   dialogBoard_->finished().connect(this, &PcimapResultWidget::dialogBoard_Close);
00538 }
00539 
00540 
00541 void PcimapResultWidget::dialogBoard_Close( WDialog::DialogCode dialog_code )
00542 {
00543   if ( dialog_code == WDialog::Accepted ){              // if the user wants to save the mainboard.
00544 
00545     string board_name = editBoard_->text().narrow();    // retrieve the name given by the user.
00546     if( board_name != "" ){
00547       storeMainBoard( board_name );                     // store the mainboard configuration..
00548       delete dialogBoard_;
00549     }
00550     else
00551       dialogBoard_->show();
00552   }
00553 }

00576 static std::vector<PciDevice> lspci_list_backup;
00577 
00578 
00579 void PcimapResultWidget::storeMainBoard( string board_name )
00580 {
00581   std::vector<string> uDevIdList;                       // Hold unique device IDs.
00582   string board_id = queryBoardModelId( board_name );    // Query to see if board already exists in database.
00583   
00584   if ( board_id  == "" ){                               // Board does not exist in database..
00585     board_id = insertBoardModel( board_name );          // insert it in database and retrieve it's ID.
00586 
00587     uDevIdList = getUniqueDevIdList();                  // Get unique IDs of devices in lspci_list_.
00588     
00589     insertBoardDevices( board_id, uDevIdList );         // Insert devices belonging to the board to database.
00590 
00591     // @TODO: !!! ALSO INSERT INTO DEV_MOD.. something like: checkDeviceModules( uDevIdList );
00593 
00594     dialogWarn_->setWindowTitle("Mainboard");
00595     txtWarn_->setText("Mainboard Saved!");
00596     dialogWarn_->show();
00597 
00598     lspci_list_backup = lspci_list_;            // Stash lspci_list_ so we can refresh the page with board name.
00599 
00600     // So remove the page, delete it and create a new instance providing currently saved board name.
00601     removeWidget( PcimapResultWidget::Instance() );
00602     delete PcimapResultWidget::Instance();
00603     selectWidget( PcimapResultWidget::Instance( lspci_list_backup, parent_, board_name) );
00604   }
00605   else{                                                 // Board already exists, so we do nothing, just warn!
00606     dialogWarn_->setWindowTitle("Mainboard Exists");
00607     txtWarn_->setText("Mainboard with the given name already exists in database!");
00608     dialogWarn_->show();
00609   }
00610   
00611 }
00612 
00613 
00614 
00615 /*
00616   Check if the given PCI device is stored in database before.
00617 */
00619 string checkPciSpcId( const PciDevice* const currentPciDevice );
00620 
00621 /*
00622   Check if the given device is stored in database before.
00623   Might be any device depending on bus type, designed for future growth of database with different busses.
00624 */
00626 string checkUniqueDeviceId( string dev_special_id, int bus_type = 1 );
00627 
00628 
00629 std::vector<string> PcimapResultWidget::getUniqueDevIdList()
00630 {
00631   std::vector<string> uDevIdList;                   // Hold unique device IDs of listed PCI Devices.
00632   string pciSpcId, uDevId;                          // Hold PCI special ID and unique device ID.
00633 
00634   // Iterate through the listed PCI Devices.
00635   std::vector<PciDevice>::iterator lspci_iter;
00636   for( lspci_iter = lspci_list_.begin(); lspci_iter != lspci_list_.end(); ++lspci_iter ){
00637 
00638     pciSpcId = checkPciSpcId( &*lspci_iter ); // Returns PCI special ID from `pci_all' db table,adds if not exists
00639     uDevId = checkUniqueDeviceId( pciSpcId ); // Returns unique device ID from `all_devices', adds if not exists..
00640     
00641     uDevIdList.push_back( uDevId );
00642     
00643   }
00644 
00645   return uDevIdList;
00646 }
00647

00649 
00650 void PcimapResultWidget::resetAll()
00651 {
00652   removeWidget( PcimapResultWidget::Instance() );
00653   delete PcimapResultWidget::Instance();
00654 }
